strapiEdition.headline: Reunited And It Feels So Good

posts.title: Yarn/Wire Debuts Forest Concerts Series At The Momentary
posts.content:
NYC-based piano and percussion quartet Yarn/Wire is coming to the Momentary Mar 3-5 for the US premiere of Forest Concerts.

  • Enchanted forest: Commissioned by the Momentary and composed by Øyvind Torvund, this family-oriented, interactive performance combines energetic music, narration, comics, and sound to create an environment where kids and adults can invent, discover, and collect sounds.
  • Quartet's cause: Yarn/Wire promotes creative, experimental new music in the US and abroad by supporting composers and audiences through live performances, educational activities, and large-scale collaborative projects.

Tickets are $30 and can be purchased HERE.

posts.title: Country Living Lists Eureka Springs As Best Arkansas Small Town
posts.content:
Eureka Springs was recognized by Country Living on its recent list of Best Small Towns to Visit in Every State for a Charming Weekend.

  • Historic charm: Characterized by Victorian homes along winding mountainside streets, Eureka Springs' entire downtown is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
  • Adventure: Nestled in the Ozark Mountains near Beaver Lake, Eureka Springs has many outdoor activities like water sports, camping, fishing, and mountain biking.

Find plenty of activities to enjoy in Eureka Springs HERE.

posts.title: Arkansas Black Music & Film Expo Kicks Off This Friday In Fayetteville
posts.content:
Celebrate Black arts, music, and film in NWA during the Arkansas Black Music & Film Expo in Fayetteville this weekend, Feb 17-18.

  • Film frenzy: Friday will center on film with fantastic screenings from former Razorback and Emmy Nominee Quinn Grovey, local filmmaker Michael Day, and a showing of Fire in Little Africa, a heart-stirring multimedia documentary remembering the 1921 Massacre.
  • Sound sensation: Saturday will begin with the Mardi Gras Parade at 2p featuring the UAPB Marching Band, followed by the music expo with performances by The Racy Brothers and Crescent City Combo at George's Majestic Lounge.

Find more information and get tickets HERE.

posts.title: Used-Vehicle Giant CarMax Eyes Rogers for Next Superstore
posts.content:
CarMax, the nation's largest buyer and seller of used vehicles, is seeking approval to build its first Arkansas superstore location in Rogers.

  • The proposal: The dealer is in conversation with the city planning commission over plans to build a 42,909 sqft building on a 17.4-acre site at 6360 S. Dixieland Rd.
  • Estimates: According to Talk Business & Politics, CarMax typically invests $10-$25m in the development of each store location which will hold 200-400 used vehicles on its lot.

Check out TB&P for more details HERE.

posts.title: Reuniting Razorback Greenway At I-49 In Bentonville
posts.content:
After being disconnected during construction on the interstate, the Razorback Regional Greenway at I-49 in Bentonville is finally being realigned in order to restore full trail access to those living in the northern city limits.

  • In the meantime: The construction is expected to take over six months, during which the Greenway will remain open with occasional closures and detours. Stay up to date by following @playbentonville and @WeAreTrailblazers.
  • Free for the public: The project's total cost is over $1.75m, at no cost to taxpayers, thanks to grants from the Walton Family Foundation, the NWA Regional Planning Commission, and the Arkansas Dept. of Transportation.

Read more about the project HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Leader luncheon: Leaders in the workplace, you won't want to miss the next Lunch & Learn session by Next Level Solutions and Startup Junkie on Feb 16 to learn tools and best practices for developing and promoting a more inclusive work environment.*
  • Table for two: Fayetteville Restaurant Week is coming up Feb 19-25! Reserve your spot at Ella's Table for our $10 lunch special or our $55 three-course pre-fixe dinner. Or head to Lambeth Lounge for a $20 dinner special for two.*
  • Earth to earth: Composting is easy with Ozark Compost & Swap. Get weekly/bi-weekly compost pick-up, text notifications, and expert guides. Start composting and sign up today with the discount code NWADAILY to try your first month of biweekly free!*
  • Razorchiefs: Anna Tobkin, the lead producer for the Kansas City Chiefs and a proud Arkansas Razorback, celebrated a win last night and her third trip to the Super Bowl with the team.
  • Serve a seat: A racquet and tennis ball-themed bench honoring former coach Robert T Hodous has been added near the courts at Mount Sequoyah Center.
  • 💸 Want to help NWA Daily keep curating great content? Become a Fan of NWA Daily.
  • 📝 Looking for a job? Check out job postings from great, local companies HERE. Or, if you're looking to hire, get your job posting on the job board.
  • 🚀 Want your message to reach our 24,000+ subscribers? Contact us here.
